They will provide one return to Cabinet Office capturing information for all their relevant organisations.

column1: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
column3: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
column41: In March 2021 HMRC issued Defra with an assessment for tax in the sum of £8,495,449.55 after a voluntary disclosure was made to declare the erroneous recovery of VAT on supplies of staff. This amount relates to contingent labour costs not recorded in Defra’s Headcount and Payroll Data from 1st January 2017 to 31st March 2020. Accordingly, Defra has included this cost in the March 2021 return.

column3: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

column42: There has been a decrease in the number of non-payroll staff due to some personnel being incorrectly declared in previous months.

column3: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
column41: AHDB is funded through a levy paid by farmers and others in the agricultural supply chain. No funding towards staffing or other running costs is received from the government.

column3: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
column42:
Some of the reasons for this increase on last year are:
Increased flood budgets for 20-21 compared to last year.
Many of the projects in 20-21 are high level projects from Water Story, Natural Capital, Net Zero Carbon Programme.
There have also been some sizeable costs to do with both COVID19 & Incident response and recovery over the last year.
Many of these projects have required specialised knowledge for which we have had to bring in consultants.
The usual year end accruals process and capturing unbilled costs always inflates the March numbers.
